text: Thomas Starr King (December 17, 1824 - March 4, 1864) was an American Unitarian minister. Many people think he influenced California politics during the American Civil War. He was a Freemason. Starr King spoke in favor of the Union. ==References== Category:1824 births Category:1864 deaths Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Deaths from diphtheria Category:Educators from New York City Category:American activists Category:Unitarians
title: Thomas Starr King
